physical_appearance:This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and portrait in orientation. It features two opponents in a boxing ring
 with a referee. The referee is dressed in a white shirt and trousers. The boxers are wearing boxing shorts and shoes. The man on the right is wearing a hooded mask. There are no inscriptions on the photograph. There are no tears or folds seen.

subject_terms_4:
sgcool_label_text:This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life
 including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.

metadata.title_text: "Personal photograph album titled ""Sixteen Months in Singapore""" Sixteen Months in Singapore: Photograph of boxing match
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and portrait in orientation. It features two opponents in a boxing ring, with a referee. The referee is dressed in a white shirt and trousers. The boxers are wearing boxing shorts and shoes. The man on the right is wearing a hooded mask. There are no inscriptions on the photograph. There are no tears or folds seen.
metadata.sgcool_label_text: This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life, including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.
